violated_sc.evidence_source: description: Note that whilst the heading in the main section reads 'Adding a new Page', the title in the browser tab reads 'Editing Page [...]'
violated_sc.violation_reason: The page title in the browser tab does not accurately describe the purpose of the page, which can confuse users, especially those using screen readers, as it does not reflect the action being performed (adding vs. editing).

violated_sc.evidence_source: description: They all have the same CSS class, no id or caption and the current xpath for the {{table}} selector is not flexible enough

violated_sc.evidence_source: description: In Moodle, form fields that are required show a red [IMAGE] But it should be possible to get the information when you arrive at the field, not only after you leave it, so this bug is still valid.

violated_sc.evidence_source: description: PDF files being generated are non-compliant with accessibility standards in various ways... Language set to en_wp which is not a recognised lang attribute

violated_sc.evidence_source: description: The action menu items become incorrectly labelled from items from other action menus because of element ID collision.

violated_sc.evidence_source: description: The action menu items become incorrectly labelled from items from other action menus because of element ID collision.

violated_sc.evidence_source: description: The current implementation of the ordering question type plugin attempts to provide an alternative to dragging items by allowing users to click instead. violated_sc.evidence_source: description: There is no alternative text for the profile image in the main content. Informative images require descriptive alt text.

violated_sc.evidence_source: description: There is no keyboard access to the calendar that opens when clicking the calendar icon button

violated_sc.violation_reason: The focus order is not logical or intuitive as it shifts to 'Skip to main content' instead of the next element in the sequence, which can confuse users navigating with a keyboard.

violated_sc.evidence_source: description: Fieldsets are present in the filters dropdown without corresponding legends. Note that the legend must be the first element of the fieldset.
violated_sc.violation_reason: The absence of legends in fieldsets violates SC 1.3.1 because it fails to provide the necessary semantic information and relationships that assistive technologies rely on to convey the structure and purpose of grouped form controls.
